page.title: 03Amenities in Coalville:
page.content: { Coalville}is in a state of change. Corner Shops have closed but super- markets, such as Kwik Save, Co-op Superstore and Fine Fair have opened. The open-air market has been replaced by a Covered Market Hall, which opens every Tuesday, Friday and Saturday, supplements the grand{Broadway {Shopping Centre. This change is also apparent in the Leisure facilities available. The three cinemas have closed, the Casino became a Bingo Hall, the Grand is now a Discotheque while the Rex stands empty. The Swimming Pool has closed,to be replaced by some Old Peoples Flats. Many of the open spaces, such as the allotments and parks, have been built upon. A new library was built in 1979, containing{58,812}books. However the Greyhound Stadium still operates on Tuesdays and Fridays.
